result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jason D Edgerly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
There is a 2-year diversion agreement between the DA and Defendant on Count 1/battery; Defendant's bond remains in effect during that diversion agreement.

Conditions for Count 2: Complete any educational classes and/or counseling by the discretion of the agent.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete 24- or 26-week domestic abuse class at the discretion of the agent.  Pay costs of supervision.  Court costs have been paid out of the bond on deposit.  Balance owed to the Court is $0.  See Assessment Report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason D Edgerly in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Lawrence presents the amended complaint to the court as well as the proposed diversion agreement. Atty Forehand states def will pleading to both charges. Def does not object to the amended complaint.  Atty Lawrence states he will waive the formal reading of charges. Court states charges and informs max possible penalties. Def pleads no contest to both charges. Court's colloquy on plea. Findings of guilt. 

Sentence: Follow joint recommendation. Count 1/battery - 24 mo diversion agreement ordered.  Count 2/dc: sentence withheld for 12 months probation. Conditions: complete any educational classes and/or counseling by the discretion of agent; attend, pay for, and successfully complete a 24- or 26- week domestic abuse class at the discretion of the agent; pay costs. Bond will remain in effect, no modifications need to be made to current bond.

Status conference on February 17, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on March 17, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on March 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court by authorization for Defendant Jason D Edgerly. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA requests 2 day trial.  3/23 and 3/24.  FPT 3/17 at 2.  Final status 2/17 at 2.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2017 at 02:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jason D Edgerly not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Jason D Edgerly.  Further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jason D Edgerly in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Formal reading waived.  NG entered.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jason D Edgerly in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court states charges and informs def of possible max. penalties as well as rights; instructs def to call SPD re eligibility.  Court adjourns this matter to 6/1 at 10 a.m.  Def addresses the Court re bond, particularly the no contact condition. Victim addresses the Court; asks for deletion of the no contact. State agrees.  Court drops the no contact.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Matter recalled.  Def informs the Court that he plans to hire an attorney privately prior to the next court date.
to Those Posting Cash Bond - signed by poster 3/5/16; received by clerk 3/8/16
RCSD B/R - conditions:  no contact with TME
